results.title: Ladies and gentlemen...Mr Leonard Cohen
results.creator_credit: John Kemeny, ONF | NFB, Donald Brittain and Don Owen
results.brief_description: Presents an informal portrait of the Montreal poet, Leonard Cohen, on the platform reading to his audience, at other times alone, or with family or friends. Among his writings are a novel, THE FAVOURED GAME and two books of poems, SPICE BOX OF THE EARTH and FLOWERS FOR HITLER, which are read and quoted avidly by young people in Canada and the United States. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Philadelphia)

results.title: The Kid Stakes
results.brief_description: One of Australia’s major silent features, ‘The Kid Stakes’ concerns Fatty Finn and his gang. As they are preparing to enter their pet goat, Hector, in the goat-cart race, a member of a rival gang lets Hector escape on the very morning of the race. The adventures of Fatty and the gang in their attempt to rescue Hector are told with charm and humour. As a document of Australian clothes, customs, jokes and appearances of the era, this film is a valuable historical record. Based on Syd Nicholls’ comic strip characters that appeared in the Sydney Sunday News newspaper. Cast includes Ray Salmon, Frank Boyd, Robin Ordell and Charles Roberts. Cinematography by Arthur Higgins.

results.title: Jewellery making. Part 2: casting
results.brief_description: The second film in a series introducing the techniques of modern jewellery making. Demonstrates two popular methods of using cuttlefish bones and “lost wax” for preparing moulds to create solid jewellery shapes and sizes by two leading Australian jewellers, Rex Keogh and Norman Creighton.

results.title: Jewellery making. Part 1: metal working
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Terry Jennings
results.brief_description: The first in a series of three films on the techniques used in the creation of modern jewellery by professional craftsmen. Explains the techniques of sawing, drilling, soldering and finally filing and polishing various metals to make strikingly attractive jewellery.

results.title: It's easy when you know how
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram, South Australian Film Corporation and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description: Children who have difficulty in learning may be lacking in the basic skills of the spoken or written language. They may appear to be dull, difficult, dyslexic or handicapped but step by step teaching may reveal that they have the ability to learn.

results.title: The Italian straw hat
results.brief_description: Farce about the Paris bourgeoisie. One visual detail after another creates a devastatingly witty satire at the expense of the French middle class. Set in Paris, 1895, the story concerns a bridegroom whose horse eats a Leghorn straw hat of a young married woman absorbed in a clandestine love affair. The wedding day must be interrupted while the groom searches frantically for an identical hat. Adapted from the play by Eugene Labiche and Marc Michel (II). Credits include: photographers, Maurice Desfassiaux, Nikolas Roudakoff; music, Jacques Ibert; editing, Henry Dobb; art designer, Lazare Meerson; costume design by Souplet; assistant directors, Lily Jumel and Georges Lacombe.

results.title: It might be you
results.brief_description: A number of people leave their respective homes by car, bicycle and on foot; they all just manage to avoid accidents until they all arrive at the same stretch of road and collide. Some of the people in the film escape unharmed - others don’t. This is a road safety film with a difference. Features Peter Cushing.

results.title: It couldn't happen
results.brief_description: Burns are one of the most frequent types of domestic accidents, particularly to children. The variety of situations in which accidental burning can happen are explored, the elements that are involved and how they can be minimised. In particular, it details the importance of the material in, and the design of children’s clothes.
